original_title: Sri Lanka services exports up 5.9-pct in March 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT –  Sri Lanka’s services exports were estimated to have increased 5.8 percent to 543 million US dollars in March 2023 from a year earlier, the island’s Export Development Board (EDB) said.
Services exports estimated is made up of IT or Business Process Management (BPM), construction, financial services, transport and logistics.
There are more than 500 ICT companies, according to the EDB,
Sri Lanka’s merchandise exports decreased by 1.96 percent to US dollars 1.03 billion dollars in March 2023 from a year ago.
The fall is said to be due to the lower demand for products in major markets due to the current economic situation.
Sri Lanka’s goods exports are slowing amid lower growth in Western markets. (Colombo/May11/2023)
